intro: Glyaspermum ramiflorum, commonly known as the branching-flower glyaspermum, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. Glyaspermum ramiflorum is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with deep roots that help it access water from underground sources. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
